clinical_study.brief_title: Personalized Vaccine for Patients With Recurrent Malignant Glioma
clinical_study.official_title: Personalized Vaccine for Patients With Recurrent Malignant Glioma: a Single-arm, Single-center, Open-labeled Study

brief_summary.textblock: A single-arm, single-center, open-labeled study will be conducted with an aim to investigate the feasibility, safety, and efficacy of the personalized vaccine for patients with recurrent malignant glioma.

primary_outcome.measure: incidences of advent events and severe advent events
primary_outcome.time_frame: from initiation of study treatment to 28 weeks post-vaccination
primary_outcome.description: would be monitored and measured according to the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (version 4.X.)

secondary_outcome.measure: object response rate (ORR) according to iRANO criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from initiation of study treatment to 24 weeks post-vaccination (last shot)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR including complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) would be assessed and measured based on the conditions proposed by iRANO criteria
time interval (measured in weeks) between initiation of study treatment to progression of disease
time interval (measured in weeks) from initiation of study treatment to the death of patients

secondary_outcome.measure: immune response based on the criteria encoded by GRT-C903 and GRT-R904
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of treatment (up to approximately 12 months)
secondary_outcome.description: humoral and cellular immune responses including generation of specific antibodies, inflammatory factors, immune cells, will be measured as proposed by GRT-C903 and GRT-R904

arm_group.description: patients with recurrent malignant gliomas enrolled into this arm will receive the personalized vaccine through sub-cutaneous.

intervention.description: Based on genetic and transcriptional sequencing information, personalized peptide vaccines would be designed and produced; patients would be vaccinated on day 1, 4, 8 ,15, 22 and then on week 12, 20.
